title: Forms (cf. Part 110)
content:
Forms (cf. Part 110)

State Regulations

Form A - Examination order (inpatient examination)

Form A-1 - Application and order to authorize confinement for additional period

Form B - Examination order (outpatient examination)

Form B-1 - Application and order to extend examination period

Form C - Confinement order to sheriff

Form D - Order discharging defendant unconditionally

Form E - Order discharging defendant subject to order of conditions

Form F - Civil order of commitment

Form G - Commitment order

Form CPL 018 - Order for commitment of defendant acquitted by reason of mental disease or defect

Form H - Application for first retention order and notice of application

Form I - First retention order

Form J - Application for second retention order and notice of application

Form K - Second retention order

Form L - Application for subsequent retention order and notice of application

Form M - Subsequent retention order

Form N - Order of conditions

Form O - Application for transfer order and notice of application

Form P - Transfer order

Form Q - Application for release order and notice of application

Form R - Release order

Form S - Application for recommitment order and notice of application

Form S-1 - Order to appear

Form S-2 - Warrant

Form S-3 - Temporary confinement order

Form T - Recommitment order

Form U - Application for furlough order and notice of application

Form V - Furlough order

Form W - Application for discharge order and notice of application

Form X - Discharge order

Form Y - Examination report by qualified psychiatric examiner

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
